title: MEDIA
description: In charge of media for engineering conference which includes all media exposure.
requirements: Web Developer: Preparing the conference website (HTML, CSS, JavaScript knowledge preferred)
Social Media Manager: Manages social media pages for the conference.
Photographer/video recorder: Responsible for conference footage.
Photo editor: Should have experience with Abode Illustrator and/or Photoshop.
Video editor: In charge of recording the whole process of the conference to create a movie after.

title: ADMINISTRATION
description: In charge of all conference documentation which includes but not limited to: legal paperwork, information packages, student introductory package, chair guidelines package, committee terminology package and committee topic package.
requirements: Completed Lower-division writing courses, documentation experience preferred, upper-div writing course completion preferred.

title: ORGANIZER
description: In charge conference logistics including but not limited to: venue preparation and setup, attendee registration, directing attendees, organizing conference flow.
requirements: Teamwork and Leadership experience, event organizing experience preferred.

title: OUTREACH
description: Members of the outreach team will have various responsibilities which are directed towards contacting sponsors and preparing a sponsorship proposal, inviting keynote speakers and faculty.
requirements: Public speaking skills, comfortable contacting professionals, fundraising experience, preferred.

title: CHAIRS BOARD
description: In charge of researching contemporary engineering problems to provide committee topics. Each chair on the board will be one of the chairs in charge of a conference committee that will provide attendees with content and guidelines to successfully brainstorm solutions and debate. Chairs will run debate sessions using Robert’s Rules of Order.
requirements: Proficient engineering knowledge, capable of enforcing Robert’s rules of order, good communication, public speaking and leadership skills.

title: EVENT PLANNING
description: Members will be in charge of planning various entertainment events including the conference opening and closing ceremonies and networking break events.
requirements: Commitment, good communication skills, organization skills, comfortable with reaching out to on campus organizations.
